arts.ttl: Preview: Stevenage vs. Wrexham - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Tuesday's League One clash between Stevenage and Wrexham, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Stevenage 1 Charlton Athletic 0 - Addicks lack of cutting edge punished on the road
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic: Mannion, Ramsay, A Mitchell, Jones, Potts (Gillesphey 75), Edwards (Berry 75), Coventry, Anderson (Watson 88), T Campbell, Godden (Aneke 57), Kanu (Docherty 88). Roberts’ goal gave the home side the advantage and despite trying everything – including playing defender Lloyd Jones as an extra forward in the closing stage – the Addicks could not breach the Stevenage defence.

arts.ttl: Nathan Jones after 1-0 defeat at Stevenage: Charlton Athletic must improve in the final third
arts.sum: Then we’ve had the best chance. “We work religiously on [creating chances].

arts.ttl: Jordan Roberts earns Stevenage victory over Charlton
Roberts keeps Stevenage in a Lamex wonderland with win over Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: Jordan Roberts had fired Boro in front midway through the second half, starring in and finishing off a wonderfully executed counter attack. Dan Butler also hit a free-kick down the throat of Will Mannion and Boro did finish the half stronger, forcing a couple of corners, which was where the skipper found himself unmarked to guide his header goalwards.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic manager Nathan Jones responds to Cardiff City job link and bookies odds
arts.sum: The South London Press was told earlier this week that Charlton had not received any contact from Cardiff in relation to Jones. Asked about being one of the favourites with the bookies for the Cardiff vacancy, he told the South London Press today: “When this kind of stuff comes up I’m very flattered to be linked with that.
